Description: Foot sherd of East Greek, possibly Chian, pottery vessel; low pedestal foot with slight ridge at join with body; creamy slip; exterior, from top: single brown band on ridge; downward rays on foot between lines; on edge of foot, band of dots; underside reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The interior diameter is too wide for the sherd to belong to a chalice and the decoration is not typical of chalices. In all likelihood, the sherd belongs to a large vessel, possibly an amphora.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2204)
